intro: Spilanthes decumbens var. macropoda, commonly known as the large-flowered toothache plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the genus Spilanthes within the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, hairy stems and clusters of yellow, daisy-like flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a strong, pungent odor, which can be irritating to the skin. This species is often found in prairie habitats and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
